extends java.lang.Object
implements ActivitySource

    • Constructor Detail

      • EditorWorkPanel

        public EditorWorkPanel(java.lang.String name,
                       EditorDialog.PanelType type)
        Creates a new work panel with the given individual and type name.
        Parameters:
        name - String panel name
        type - String panel type name

    • Method Detail

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets the ENABLED state of this work panel.
        Parameters:
        enable - boolean true == set panel enabled

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Whether this work panel is in ENABLED state. This affects GUI status and whether components are editable.
        Returns:
        boolean true == enabled

      • readData

        public abstract void readData()
        Reads all data from required for this panel from the editor's source.

      • writeData

        public abstract void writeData()
        Writes editable data of this panel to the editor's sink. This may be restricted to data which has been modified since last write or read.

      • verify

        public boolean verify()
        Returns true if the editable data set of this panel is in a consistent state.
        Returns:
        boolean true == data consistent

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the individual name of this work panel.
        Returns:
        String name

      • getView

        public javax.swing.JPanel getView()
        Returns the GUI view of this work panel. The default JPanel returned carries the individual name of this work panel.
        Returns:
        JPanel

      • setView

        public void setView(javax.swing.JPanel view)
        Sets the JPanel which serves as view of this work panel. If the panel does not carry a individual name, this work panel's name is assigned to it.
        Parameters:
        view - JPanel

      • getType

        public EditorDialog.PanelType getType()
        Returns the type name of this work panel.
        Returns:
        String name

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Set the individual name of this work panel.
        Parameters:
        name - String

      • setType

        public void setType(EditorDialog.PanelType name)
        Set the type name of this work panel.
        Parameters:
        name - String

      • endEdit

        public void endEdit()
        Called to invoke termination of ongoing editing tasks and saving all modified data of this panel to its sink.

      • panelShown

        public void panelShown()
        Called after a panel was brought to display.

      • panelHiding

        public boolean panelHiding()
        Called immediately before a panel is stepping into the background. Normally after endEdit() was called. This method has the option to veto the process of bringing the panel to background.
        Returns:
        boolean true == ready, false == break this task (do not hide!)

      • panelClosing

        public boolean panelClosing()
        Called immediately before a panel is terminally closed. This method has the option to veto the process of closing the panel.
        Returns:
        boolean true == ready, false == break this task (do not close!)

      • displayValue

        public void displayValue(java.lang.String field)
        Called to bring the named data field to editable display.
        Parameters:
        field - String data field name

      • isShowing

        public boolean isShowing()
        Whether this panel is currently showing in the GUI.
        Returns:
        boolean true == panel showing

      • eventOccurred

        public void eventOccurred(EditorWorkPanel.EditorPanelEvent evt)
        Called to indicate a system wide editor event.
        Parameters:
        evt - EditorPanelEvent

      • notifyFieldValue

        public void notifyFieldValue(java.lang.String field,
                             java.lang.Object value,
                             EditorWorkPanel source)
        Called to inform this panel about a modified field value. The given value is the new value. The field name can be any name, not restricted to fitting to this panel.
        Parameters:
        field - String field name
        value - Object new field value
